rounds.comments: (Ken: That letter sequence appears in each response.)

clues.text: It's the feline name for the runway where models strut their stuff
It can mean asunder or a pair, like in that famous line about them never meeting
This German Air Force was officially announced in 1935, at which time it already had hundreds of planes
There's no wiggle room in this word for a miser
It's a formal ruling on a point of Islamic law; one was famously rendered against Salman Rushdie in 1989

Wordsworth:
"My heart leaps up when I behold a ____ in the sky: so was it when my life began; so is it now I am a man"

Henry Wadsworth Longfellow:
"Ready to ride and spread the ____, through every Middlesex village and farm"
Emily Dickinson: "Because I could not stop for death/ He kindly stopped for me/ The carriage held but just ourselves/ And ____"

W.E. Henley:
"I have not winced nor cried aloud / Under the bludgeonings of chance / My head is bloody but ____"

Anne Sexton:
"I have gone out, a possessed ____, haunting the black air, braver at night"

For those who enjoy the outdoors:
F&S

"Where food and culture meet":
BA

A trip to Cuba inspired the creation of this magazine for stogie fans:
CA

For savvy women with a sense of style & interest in global issues:
MC

Has published articles by more than 200 Nobel Prize winners:
SA

rounds.category: TOP ROW OF THE KEYBOARD WORDS

clues.text: A traveling group of ballet dancers
It's a regional version of a complimentary word, as in "that's a real ____ dress you've got on"
Adjective for a county that allows the sale of alcoholic beverages
I've heard it said, that Jennings fellow is quick with this, a witty remark
"A fit of" often precedes this, a feeling of irritation or resentment
Hunting in Texas, this vice president shot his pal in the face with birdshot, but somehow the pal ended up apologizing
A tough way to bat .400 for governors of this state; 4 of its 10 past leaders went to prison, so better keep yer nose clean, J.B. Pritzker
Ex-rep. William Jefferson got this 2-word alliterative nickname that summed up the $90,000 found in the man's freezer by the FBI
In 2024 this N.J. sen. was looking at a lot longer than a 6-year term after being found guilty on 16 counts, including bribery
In the 1920s a petroleum exec gave the Sec. of the Interior 100K in a "loan" (wink wink) & it was a tempest in this scandal

Legendary actress Liz &
NBA great Elgin

Quarterback Eli &
actress Stockard

Author Erik &
frontiersman Kit

1980s CIA director William &
pianist Count

American playwright Arthur &
German playwright Friedrich

rounds.comments: (Ken: These are all words containing three of the letter "T".)

clues.text: It can mean a new colony, or a business agreement negotiated to resolve a dispute
For decades consumers have complained about this persistence in the diet soda drinking experience
Oscar Wilde quipped that he could resist anything but this
A woman's undergarment often trimmed with ruffles or lace
The author of the text of an opera
"The Boys in the Boat" is the saga of a U.S. rowing team winning gold at the 1936 Olympics in this city
A riveting minute-by-minute account, Walter Lord's "A Night to Remember" reignited interest in this disaster
Thor Heyerdahl wrote of sailing the Kon-Tiki across the Pacific & a small craft named for this Egyptian sun god across the Atlantic
Piers Paul Read's "Alive" is the true story of a plane crash & its survivors' fight for life in these mountains
Jessica Bruder traveled the U.S. in a van named "Halen", writing the book called this "land" that inspired an Oscar-winning film
Thorkell the Tall led an invasion of England by these folks from Scandinavia in 1009
It preceded "of the Rights of Man and of the Citizen" in the title of a document adopted in August 1789
On May 31 & June 1, 1921 a white mob in this city pillaged & burned a prosperous business district known as Black Wall Street
Last name of Gonzalo, who as governor of Peru took up arms against Spain after his half-brother Francisco's death
The black death hit this "colorful" Mongol group in 1346 & '47, & it was downhill from there
What chalupa would be complete without some Jalapeño Noir, which was, sadly, a limited-time wine offering from this chain
No bull--Aldebaran is the brightest star in this zodiac constellation
The New Testament says, "Now abideth" this trio of virtues, with the last one being the greatest
In this novel, Major Major Major is made a major by an "I.B.M. machine with a sense of humor almost as keen as his father's"
As a lab-grown crystal, miassite can act as one of these, meaning it has no electrical resistance once cooled

rounds.comments: (Ken: As befitting knights, all responses here begin with "Sir".)

clues.text: This knight was so plump his belly was equal to pi times his diameter
He told everyone of his skills for when Britain became even more anarchic, like finding food & shelter & making fires in the wild
For a boundary dispute with a rival king, King Arthur called on this knight equipped to settle the issue
This knight had rhythm! Though sadly more to do with 24-hour time periods than with music
He always took the kind of route named for him--6 hours of twists & turns for what should be a 2-hour ride back to Camelot
The original "Wizard of Oz" novel featured this adjective that's not in the film title
Latin for soul gives us this adjective that can describe lively people as well as cartoon characters
Related to the word "diamond", it means unyielding or inflexible, perhaps in your opinion
From French for "green", it can mean green in color or inexperienced
From a Latin word meaning to boil or bubble, it describes someone bubbly & enthusiastic

rounds.text: Named for a 1775 battle, this city contains the graves of John Breckinridge & Henry Clay
